ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A lot of hands-on skills and experiences. Loved working on the projects and lab reports.
I learned how to apply many techniques that we learned about in class to real-life situations where contact with microbes is made.
Microbiology lab and general biology lab techniques.
Microbiology lab techniques, scientific writing
Basic foundations of microbiology lab techniques!

I learned how to culture microorganisms on plates and in broth, how to perform stains for microscopy, and about many other tests for determining the identity of microbes isolated from different environments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very well organized. Very clear instructions. Love the professor's vibes. For the first time, didn't think going to lab was a chore. Work was not that tedious and they allowed us to leave as soon as our work was done.

The class is very well structured. Every week we are given specific experiments to perform, what they are testing, what to look for, and why bother with performing them. Many of us were premeds, so the connection between the experiments and the medical field were appreciated by many.
Everything was a strength to the content and the professor.
Very good class with highly interesting and fun labs.
This course had assignments that were well distributed throughout the entire semester. We received timely feedback and the laboratory sessions were great

Strengths: Good lab to learn basic bio techniques

Weaknesses: Sometimes it was difficult to follow instructions when they were just written on paper, especially for the gram and simple staining lab.

The experiments we did in this course were really interesting and I learned a lot of lab techniques that I had never done before.

One weakness of this course I felt was that a fair amount of knowledge (such as how to use pipettes or a microscope properly) was assumed. The assignments also were not always clear in terms of content or due date.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100%! Do it for Professor Hartman. She's the best and has been a shining moment in my experience of the MCDB department. Very refreshing and chill and supportive.
Yes, Professor Hartman is a great instructor, and the experiments are super fun.
Definitely. Prof Hartman is a saint.
Yes! 100% if Professor Hartman is teaching it!
Yes! Definitely take this if you need a lab course and it is a great companion lab to the microbiology lecture.
Yes. Professor Hartman is great and the course was very interesting. It supplements perfectly to the microbiology course class.
Yes!! It was my first time taking a bio wet lab and Prof Amaleah Hartman helped keep the lab environment very friendly and stress-less.
Yes, it is a good complement to MCDB 290.
